reference_no_or_id: Criminal Bail Application No.204 and M.A. No.497 of 2007

accussed_details.name: Sohrab
allegation: Offences under sections 302, 459, 148, and 149 of P.P.C.

complaint_summary: The accused was alleged to be present at the crime scene along with another individual but no overt act or direct involvement in the crime was attributed to him.
investigation_summary: The FIR indicated the presence of the accused at the crime scene but did not allege any active participation or overt act in the crime.
judgment_summary: The court granted bail to the accused, Sohrab, on the grounds that no overt act or direct involvement in the crime was attributed to him. Bail was granted upon furnishing a surety of Rs. 200,000 as P.R. Bond to the satisfaction of the trial court.
punishment: Bail granted with surety of Rs. 200,000 as P.R. Bond.
legal_arguments: No overt act attributed to the accused.
Presence at the crime scene does not establish direct involvement.
key_issues: Whether the accused's presence at the crime scene constitutes sufficient grounds for denial of bail.
Whether further inquiry is required to establish the accused's involvement.

words_and_phrases.Overt act: An open and observable action that constitutes part of a crime.

summary_vector_notes: The judgment granted bail to the accused due to lack of evidence of direct involvement or overt act in the crime. The case was deemed to require further inquiry.
